visibility.description: Appropriate parts of the product visible and convey correct message
visibility.application: Make system status, available actions, and results of actions visible to users
implementation_guidance: Clear visual hierarchy and information architecture

feedback.description: User receives full and continuous feedback about results of actions
feedback.application: Provide immediate, informative feedback for all user interactions

constraints.description: Physical and logical constraints guide allowable actions
constraints.application: Use design constraints to prevent errors and guide user behavior

mapping.description: Relationship between controls and their actions follows natural mapping
mapping.application: Design intuitive relationships between interface elements and their functions
implementation_guidance: Natural correspondence between actions and effects

consistency.description: Similar situations have similar actions and similar results
consistency.application: Maintain consistency within and across interfaces
implementation_guidance: Design system and pattern library usage

affordances.description: Perceived properties suggest how object should be used
affordances.application: Design interface elements that clearly suggest their functionality

empathize.description: Understand user needs, thoughts, emotions, and motivations
activities: Persona development and user journey mapping
Empathy mapping and user story creation

define.description: Frame user needs and problems in human-centered ways

ideate.description: Generate wide range of creative solutions

prototype.description: Build representations of solutions to test ideas

test.description: Test solutions with users and gather feedback

guideline_1_1.name: Text Alternatives
guideline_1_1.description: Provide text alternatives for non-text content
implementation: Alt text for images and graphics

guideline_1_3.name: Adaptable
guideline_1_3.description: Create content that can be presented in different ways without losing information

guideline_1_4.name: Distinguishable
guideline_1_4.description: Make it easier for users to see and hear content
implementation: Resizable text without loss of functionality
No reliance on color alone for information
Audio control and background sound management

guideline_2_1.name: Keyboard Accessible
guideline_2_1.description: Make all functionality available from keyboard

guideline_2_2.name: Enough Time
guideline_2_2.description: Provide users enough time to read and use content
implementation: Pause, stop, hide for moving content

guideline_2_3.name: Seizures and Physical Reactions
guideline_2_3.description: Do not design content that causes seizures or physical reactions
implementation: No content flashing more than 3 times per second
Animation controls and reduced motion options

guideline_2_4.name: Navigable
guideline_2_4.description: Provide ways to help users navigate and find content

guideline_3_1.name: Readable
guideline_3_1.description: Make text content readable and understandable

guideline_3_2.name: Predictable
guideline_3_2.description: Make web pages appear and operate in predictable ways
implementation: No context changes on focus or input

guideline_3_3.name: Input Assistance
guideline_3_3.description: Help users avoid and correct mistakes

guideline_4_1.name: Compatible
implementation: ARIA labels and roles where appropriate

usability_heuristics.visibility_of_system_status: System always keeps users informed about what is going on through appropriate feedback
usability_heuristics.match_between_system_and_real_world: System speaks user's language with familiar words, phrases, and concepts
usability_heuristics.user_control_and_freedom: Users have emergency exits and undo/redo functionality
usability_heuristics.consistency_and_standards: Follow platform conventions and maintain internal consistency
usability_heuristics.error_prevention: Prevent problems from occurring in the first place
usability_heuristics.recognition_rather_than_recall: Minimize user memory load with visible options and actions
usability_heuristics.flexibility_and_efficiency: Accelerators for expert users while remaining accessible to novices
usability_heuristics.aesthetic_and_minimalist_design: Interfaces contain only relevant and necessary information
usability_heuristics.help_users_recognize_diagnose_recover: Error messages in plain language with solutions
usability_heuristics.help_and_documentation: Easy to search, focused on user's task, with concrete steps

inclusive_design_principles.recognize_exclusion: Understand how design decisions can exclude different groups of users
inclusive_design_principles.learn_from_diversity: Diverse perspectives lead to better design solutions for everyone
inclusive_design_principles.solve_for_one_extend_to_many: Solutions for specific accessibility needs often benefit all users
inclusive_design_principles.design_for_flexibility: Create interfaces that adapt to different user needs and preferences
